flawed_nl_solution:
Susan picked 3 times as much as 36 which is 3*36 = <<3*36=108>>108 apples
She gave out half which is 108*(1/2) = <<108*(1/2)=54>>54 apples
She now has 108-54 = <<108-54=54>>54 apples
Frank sold a third of 36 which is 36*(1/3) = <<36*(1/3)=12>>12 apples
Frank now has 36-12 = <<36-12=42>>42 apples
Altogether they now have 54+42 = <<54+42=96>>96 apples

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 24, not 42. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
